result.execSummary:
The defendant Grant A. Kamien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DNA sample to be provided.  AODA and any recommended follow through treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession of any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
2:29 PM Defendant Grant A. Kamien in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Grant A. Kamien.  Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court notes a written waiver of prelim has been filed.  State states joint rec.  Atty Masana and DE agree.  Court questions DE on plea agreement/prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  State has filed information.  Atty Masana waives readings and enters NC pleas to agreed counts and stands mute to the remaining charges.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in all cases.  DE pleads NC to count 1 in each of the CF cases.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Masana makes statement.  DE makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court reminds DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.
